name: Hotel Konig Von Ungarn

reviews.text: This is a great hotel in the heart of Vienna, a quick walk to the opera and main square. Our room was large and quiet, tastefully decorated. Call ahead to Michael, who has been at the hotel for more than 20 years for help with Opera tickets! We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: We love the Konig Von Ungarn!

reviews.text: We can't say enough about the Konig Von Ungarn!
reviews.title: A five star experience in a three star gem in in Vienna...

reviews.text: Vienna was the first stop on our itinerary with our daughter who had just turned 16.
reviews.title: Very Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The super clean triple room (with large bathroom) was spacious enough so that the three of us were not on top of eachother.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service, Great Room, Superb Location
Gracious hotel in Vienna
reviews.text: The breakfast was delicious and the staff, especially Michael was extremely helpful. Our daughter particularly liked the elegant indoor courtryard. Great coffee was served there as well as a cozy computer corner with free internet access.

This is our favorite hotel in Vienna out of some 6 or 7 that we’ve stayed in over the years. It’s location, down the street from Stephensdom, but on a fairly quiet street, can’t be beat. The overall impression is of a well-preserved, old place kept abreast of the times only enough as to keep guests comfortable but firmly rooted in the past, like Vienna itself.
reviews.title: Konig von Ungarn--King of Vienna hotels

reviews.text: The best part is the 3 or 4 story atrium permitting live trees in the public sitting area adjoining a pleasant bar. Dropping into one of the sofas there for a drink after a long day of sightseeing is perfection.
reviews.title: Sublime Quality and Cleanliness

likes.liked: — The level of cleanliness and tasteful decor
likes.disliked: — Clients smoking in the public areas (But isn't that Austria?)

reviews.text: All rooms are different both in size, shape and décor. Ours was big, junior-suite size with a couch, small table and sideboard which held the mini-bar. We had a nice walk in closet and the bathroom was well lighted and sparklingly clean but with old towels with the hotel’s name and crest woven into them—the crest is the crown of the “king of Hungary”—hence the hotel name, and looks like the headgear Julie Andrews wore in her numbers in Victor Victoria. Our friends’ room was smaller but had two chairs and large closet space and they were happy with it. Nightly turn down service is provided and a foot towel (does anyone know a proper name for those things?) is laid next to the bed to keep your tootsies warm and clean when alighting during the night or morning. It’s that kind of a place.
reviews.title: Our home in Vienna...

reviews.text: Breakfasts (included in the room price as are breakfasts at all but the largest chain hotels in Austria and Germany) were lovely, served in the hotel dining room, buffet style with 3 or 4 kinds of cold meats and similar variety of sliced cheeses, fruit salad, cereals, etc, etc. and eggs and sausages cooked to order on request without extra charge.
reviews.title: What A Jewel!

reviews.text: While we have eaten at the hotel dining room on past visits we did not this time—only because we had a list of other places to try, not because it doesn’t have not good. In fact, it’s quite good, serving an excellent tafelspitz (the sort of Austrian national dish, which is your basic boiled dinner) with the usual accompaniments including a good creamed spinach.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

likes.liked: — Character of hotel, location and staff.

reviews.text: My family spent three days at Hotel König von Ungarn in Vienna in June at the beginning of Euro 2008. This hotel is wonderfully situated one short block from St Stephens Cathedral. The staff is friendly and very knowledgeable. Michel was wonderful to work with while booking our stay, changing dates, re-confirming as well as setting up airport transportation upon our arrival. We stayed in the family apartment that was split level and this gave us room enough to share with two teenage girls. Breakfast was provided with our stay in the restaurant, but we opted for room service. The presentation and service were outstanding every morning. They have a wonderful driver Richard whom they work with that was great for a half day tour of the town and Vienna woods. He gave us great restaurant tips and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Simply put, this was a great place to stay in Vienna. The location was perfect, on a quiet street very near the main square and metro station. Michael Fallman is an exceptionally helpful concierge and arranged tours, concert tickets, and restaurant reservations for us. Our room was definitely unique, and the breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Great location in Vienna
We found OSITO
reviews.text: This is a classic old world style hotel with a lot of charm and character, with all that those terms imply. As an example, we found it amusing that the toilet was located in its own room off the door to the room, whereas the bathroom "proper" was on the other side of the room.
We were thrilled with this choice and would definitely choose it again.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great location make it a favorite

reviews.text: We would like to thank you all for your kind service during our short stay in Vienna last October. But specially, we are thankful to MICHAEL EISENSTEIN for taking care of sending back home our son's favorite teddy bear OSITO. We thought we had lost it elsewhere except in your hotel, still we gave it a try and were
reviews.title: A great Spot

reviews.text: Fabulous location, great ambience. This hotel has quite a historic feel to it. It is located near the St. Stephens Cathedral, so it is very convenient. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant in premisis is very good. We were very pleased with our experience here and would definintely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The Konig von Ungarn is a pretty hotel ideally situated in the centre of Vienna only a hundred yards from the cathedral. The hotel’s lounge was originally an open courtyard that was enclosed many years ago - three storeys up - by a glass roof and now forms a spacious area to sit and enjoy a drink before dinner.
reviews.title: Cosy Viennese hotel but...

likes.liked: — Spacious, spotlessly clean bedrooms and bathrooms

reviews.text: The elegant bedrooms with their spacious bathrooms are all spotlessly clean and are all decorated differently. Many of them have been refurbished recently bringing them up to more than three-star standard, but some of those that await upgrading do not yet come up to that standard.
reviews.title: Solo Travelers and Nonsmokers Beware
We agree with everything that has been said but
reviews.text: The reception staff are very helpful and the breakfast staff are a delight – very quick and obliging and always smiling, but the same cannot be said for the evening bar and restaurant staff. We arrived at the hotel at eight in the evening having been delayed for an hour at Heathrow. We asked at reception if it would still be possible to have dinner in the restaurant and a porter was dispatched immediately to check. He returned after two minutes and confirmed that it would be fine, as the restaurant was under less pressure later in the evening and would open until eleven.

There were six of us travelling together and we met at the appointed time in the lounge for a drink. When we asked about dinner, the two waiters that we spoke to were quite abrupt and unhelpful and said that it might be difficult as it was so late. Eventually we were ushered into a smaller restaurant near the bar where we enjoyed our dinner.
reviews.title: Great location in a great city

likes.liked: — Size and layout of room, location, assistance from staff
likes.disliked: — It was our last stop in Europe

description: The Hotel König von Ungarn is a first class hotel that has welcomed crowned heads of state, artists and other prominent figures since 1746.Our hotel is in the heart of Vienna just behind St. Stephan's Cathedral and close to the Vienna State Opera and many other sights.Apart from the comfort of the generously appointed rooms, the glass-covered inner courtyard is an ideal place to relax and enjoy in a traditional atmosphere.
